info.title: F5 Distributed Cloud Services API for ves.io.schema.operate.lte
info.description: Proto definitions for runtime LTE configuration on sites.

get.description: Get LTE configuration from the node

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description:
Namespace

x-example: "value"
Namespace for which the request is sent (system)

parameters.name: site
parameters.description:
Site Name

x-example: "value"
Name of the site

parameters.name: node
parameters.description:
Node Name

x-example: "master-0"
Name of the node

post.description: Update LTE configuration on the node

connected.description:
Whether the device is connected to LTE network

Example: ` "true"`
connected.title: connected

operator.description:
Network Operator to which is device connected

Example: ` "T-Mobile"`
operator.title: Operator

service_type.description:
Type of Service that is device using

Example: ` "4G"`
service_type.title: ServiceType

uptime.description:
Number of seconds the device is connected to network

Example: ` "4380"`
uptime.title: Uptime

apn.description:
Access Point Name is the name of a gateway between a mobile network and another computer network

Example: ` "internet"`
apn.title: APN

primary.description:
LTE interface is used as Primary Site Local Outside

Example: ` "true"`
primary.title: Primary

lteLteDisconnectRequest.description: Request to get Disconnect from LTE
lteLteDisconnectRequest.title: LTE Disconnect Request

namespace.description:
Namespace for which the request is sent (system)

Example: ` "value"`
namespace.title: Namespace

lteLteDisconnectResponse.description: Response to get Disconnect from LTE
lteLteDisconnectResponse.title: LTE Disconnect Response

lteLteInfoResponse.description: Runtime LTE information obtained from site.
lteLteInfoResponse.title: LTE Info Response

namespace.description:
Namespace for which the request is sent (system)

Example: ` "value"`
namespace.title: Namespace

rsrp.description:
The Reference Signals Received Power

Example: ` "-108"`
rsrp.title: RSRP

rsrq.description:
The Reference Signal Received Quality

Example: ` "-10"`
rsrq.title: RSRQ

rssi.description:
The Received Signal Strength Indication

Example: ` "-79"`
rssi.title: RSSI

sinr.description:
The Signal to Interference plus Noise Ratio

Example: ` "12.200000000000001"`
sinr.title: SINR

lteSignalStrength.description:
Current Signal Strength

 - UNKNOWN: UNKNOWN

RSSI not received
 - EXCELLENT: EXCELLENT

RSSI greater then -65
 - GOOD: GOOD

RSSI between -65 and -75
 - FAIR: FAIR

RSSI between -75 and -85
 - POOR: POOR

RSSI lower then -85
lteSignalStrength.title: SignalStrength

imei.description:
The International Mobile Equipment Identity

Example: ` "867698041438378"`
imei.title: IMEI
